alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 10 at 4:06PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...AREAS OF BLOWING SNOW TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING ALONG THE SOUTHWEST COASTLINE... Areas of blowing snow are expected tonight through Wednesday morning as new snowfall combines with strengthening winds associated with a passing front. Southerly winds will strengthen along the Kuskokwim Delta, Bristol Bay, and Nunivak Island coastlines tonight as a shortwave ridge quickly moves inland, followed by strong westerly winds associated with a frontal boundary beginning Tuesday morning. Periods of light snowfall will pair with these winds, with gusts up to 35 mph at times, which could concurrently reduce visibilities. The period most likely to experience blowing snow and reduced visibilities will be between 10PM tonight and 10AM Tuesday as increased snow rates occur along the frontal passage.
